topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5404f04b63687232882a0000#post_5404f04b63687232882a0000
I'm going to be a major toy nerd for a minute but I freaking love how figuarts figures' hips work. Basically instead of a single joint connecting the leg to the hip, there's a system of two joints that allows you to "dislocate" the leg from the hip and it allows you to raise the leg higher than most action figures, allowing you to achieve deeper crouches, higher kicks and other such coolness. It's such a subtle thing to work in that has a huge effect on the poseability. I'm amazed nobody has copied it. 


Also the figures look hilarious when you disjoint the hip while they're standing upright.
